channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hours before their shift, USAID staff received an email stating they were locked out of Washington HQ amid battle with Elon Musk’s DOGE
item.description: The move comes amid a clash between USAID, Donald Trump, and Elon Musk's DOGE initiative, which has left the agency's operations paralyzed.

item.title: GM’s 100-year-old China business can’t keep up with the EV boom there
item.description: The automaker estimates its struggling China business will cost $5 billion, but it isn't giving up on the country yet.

item.title: Trump indicates he has agreed to one-month delay in tariffs on Mexico
Call center employees in the Philippines aren’t worried about AI: The tech’s ‘not quite there yet’
item.description: Workers agree AI technology makes them more efficient, but it isn’t ready to replace them.

item.title: JPMorgan thinks this Trump administration might actually be business-unfriendly
U.S. stocks open sharply lower after Trump launches tariffs — live updates
90 days, dozens of interviews, billions on the line: Inside Blackstone’s CEO search process for its 250 companies
item.description: Blackstone follows an exhaustive and rigorous playbook for appointing CEOs. One woman makes sure it gets done right.

item.title: VW tariff exposure exceeds that of any other car company operating in U.S.
U.S. manufacturers hadn’t been so optimistic in two years. Before the tariffs.
Apple is looking for its next iPhone-like hit. Can it find it before losing momentum?
item.description: The tech giant failed to wow the masses in 2024, and 2025 isn't shaping up to be much different.
